title.narrative: Provision of Essential Reproductive Health and GBV Services to Conflict Affected Women and Girls in Quneitra Governorate,

description.narrative: RI provides support to the newly-opened Al Noor Maternity Hospital in Quneitra, so that this facility can continue to provide lifesaving and life-sustaining care to women and newborns in Quneitra governorate within the challenging context of active conflict. RI ensures that the Al Noor Maternity Hospital be supported with pharmaceuticals, consumables, incentives and operating costs, an ambulance for patient transport, and twice-yearly staff training on topics of most relevance. Of particular importance are reproductive health kits (blocks 1, 2, and 3) to serve an estimated population of 40,000 people. RI aims to create women-friendly spaces (WFS) within the camps to provide women with a safe space within the camp where they can have access to information and services. RI utilizes this space to conduct SGBV and GBV awareness raising sessions, women’s dialogue groups, life skills, PSS support, and distribute UNFPA dignity kit. To strengthen the capacity of local service providers to prevent SGBV and RI staff trains local service providers in SGBV international standards, psychological first aid, psychosocial support, and therapeutic techniques. In addition, RI trains healthcare providers at Al Noor Maternity Hospital to do Clinical Management of Rape (CMR) in order to assist survivors with intakes and referrals to medical and psychosocial support.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
